meanings.sent1: I need to remeasure the length of the table to make sure it fits in the room.
meanings.sent2: She decided to remeasure the ingredients for the recipe to avoid any mistakes.
meanings.sent3: After realizing his mistake, he had to remeasure the distance he had walked.
meanings.sent4: The tailor had to remeasure the fabric multiple times to ensure a perfect fit.
meanings.sent5: Before cutting the wood, it's important to remeasure to prevent any errors.

meanings.definition: To determine the size, amount, or degree of something again
meanings.sent1: The scientist had to remeasure the liquid in the beaker for accuracy.
meanings.sent2: It's necessary to remeasure the room dimensions before buying new furniture.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to remeasure the spices after accidentally adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: She had to remeasure her progress in the project to ensure she was on track.
meanings.sent5: The surveyor had to remeasure the land to confirm the property boundaries.
